name: src/atomic/blob.js
AtomicBlob
description: 8-bit bytes of arbitrary binary data OSC Atomic Data Type

name: pack
description: Interpret the given blob as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView and read a blob

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the blob

name: src/atomic/constant.js
content:
/**
 * Extended boolean type without data representing "True"
 */
export const VALUE_TRUE = true

/**
 * Extended boolean type without data representing "False"
 */
export const VALUE_FALSE = false

/**
 * Extended type without data representing "None"
 */
export const VALUE_NONE = null

/**
 * Extended type without data representing "Infinity"
 */
export const VALUE_INFINITY = Infinity

name: VALUE_TRUE
description: Extended boolean type without data representing "True"

name: VALUE_FALSE
description: Extended boolean type without data representing "False"

name: src/atomic/float32.js
AtomicFloat32
description: 32-bit big-endian IEEE 754 floating point number OSC Atomic Data Type

name: pack
description: Interpret the given number as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView and read a Float32 number

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the value

AtomicFloat64

name: pack

name: unpack

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the value

params.name: dataView

AtomicInt64

STR_SLICE_SIZE
description: Slice size of large strings for fallback method

name: charCodesToString
description: Helper method to decode a string using different methods depending on environment

name: AtomicString
description: A sequence of non-null ASCII characters OSC Atomic Data Type

name: pack
description: Interpret the given string as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView and read a string

params.name: dataView

name: src/atomic/timetag.js
Timetag
description:
Timetag helper class for representing NTP timestamps
and conversion between them and javascript representation

name: timestamp
description: Converts from NTP to JS representation and back

params.name: milliseconds
params.description:
Converts from JS milliseconds to NTP.
Leave empty for converting from NTP to JavaScript representation

name: AtomicTimetag
description:
64-bit big-endian fixed-point time tag, semantics
defined below OSC Atomic Data Type

params.name: value
params.description:
Initial date, leave empty if
you want it to be the current date

name: pack
description: Interpret the given timetag as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView and read a timetag

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the timetag

name: src/atomic/uint64.js
AtomicUInt64
description: Unsigned 64-bit big-endian two's complement integer OSC Atomic Data Type

name: pack
description: Interpret the given number as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView and read a UInt64 number

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the value

name: src/atomic.js
Atomic
description: Base class for OSC Atomic Data Types

name: pack
description: Interpret the given value of this entity as packed binary data

params.name: method
params.description: The DataView method to write to the ArrayBuffer

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView according to the given format

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of the value

params.name: method
params.description: The DataView method to read the format from the ArrayBuffer

name: src/bundle.js
Bundle
description:
An OSC Bundle consist of a Timetag and one or many Bundle Elements.
The elements are either OSC Messages or more OSC Bundles

name: constructor
examples: const bundle = new Bundle(new Date() + 500)

const message = new Message('/test/path', 51.2)
const anotherBundle = new Bundle([message], Date.now() + 1500)

params.name: args
params.description: Timetag and elements. See examples for options

name: timestamp
description: Take a JavaScript timestamp to set the Bundle's timetag
examples:
const bundle = new Bundle()
bundle.timestamp(Date.now() + 5000) // in 5 seconds

name: add
description: Add a Message or Bundle to the list of elements

name: pack
description: Interpret the Bundle as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data to read a Bundle

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of a Bundle

name: src/common/helpers.js
typeTag
description:
Checks type of given object and returns the regarding OSC
Type tag character

name: prepareAddress
examples:
// all calls return '/test/path' string:
prepareAddress('test/path')
prepareAddress('/test/path/')
prepareAddress([test, path])

params.name: obj
params.description: Address as string or array of strings

name: prepareRegExPattern
description: Make an OSC address pattern javascript-regex-ready

name: EncodeHelper
description:
Holds a list of items and helps to merge them
into a single array of packed binary data

name: add
description: Packs an item and adds it to the list

name: merge
description: Merge all added items into one Uint8Array

return.description: Merged binary data array of all items

name: src/common/utils.js
isInt
description: Check if given object is an integer number

name: isFloat
description: Check if given object is a float number

name: isNumber
description: Check if given object is a number

name: isString
description: Check if given object is a string

name: isBoolean
description: Check if given object is a boolean

name: isInfinity
description: Check if given object is infinity constant

name: isArray
description: Check if given object is an array

name: isObject
description: Check if given object is an object

name: isFunction
description: Check if given object is a function

name: isBlob
description: Check if given object is a Uint8Array

name: isDate
description: Check if given object is a Date

name: isUndefined
description: Check if given object is undefined

name: isNull
description: Check if given object is null

name: pad
description: Return the next multiple of four

name: hasProperty
description: Checks if environment provides a feature

name: src/events.js
dispatch
description:
Internally used method to dispatch OSC Packets. Extracts
given Timetags and dispatches them accordingly

name: call
description:
Internally used method to invoke listener callbacks. Uses regular
expression pattern matching for OSC addresses

name: notify
description:
Notify the EventHandler of incoming OSC messages or status
changes (*open*, *close*, *error*). Handles OSC address patterns
and executes timed messages. Use binary arrays when
handling directly incoming network data. Packet's or Messages can
also be used
examples: this.notify('error', error.message)

const message = new OSC.Message('/test/path', 55)
this.notify(message)

params.name: args
params.description:
The OSC address pattern / event name as string}. For convenience and
Plugin API communication you can also use Message or Packet instances
or ArrayBuffer, Buffer instances (low-level access). The latter will
automatically be unpacked
When using a string you can also pass on data as a second argument
(any type). All regarding listeners will be notified with this data.
As a third argument you can define a javascript timestamp (number or
Date instance) for timed notification of the listeners.

name: on
description: Subscribe to a new address or event you want to listen to

params.name: name
params.description: The OSC address or event name

name: off
description: Unsubscribe listener from event notification or address handler

params.name: name
params.description: The OSC address or event name

params.name: subscriptionId
params.description: Subscription id to identify the handler

name: src/external/dgram.js
src/external/ws.js
WebSocketServer
description: Do not export server for browser environments.

name: src/message.js
TypedMessage
description:
A TypedMessage consists of an OSC address and an optional array of typed OSC arguments.

## Supported types

- `i` - int32
- `f` - float32
- `s` - string
- `b` - blob
- `h` - int64
- `t` - uint64
- `d` - double
- `T` - True (no argument data)
- `F` - False (no argument data)
- `N` - Nil (no argument data)
- `I` - Infinitum (no argument data)

name: constructor
examples:
const message = new TypedMessage('/test/path', [
  { type: 'i', value: 123 },
  { type: 'd', value: 123.123 },
  { type: 'h', value: 0xFFFFFFn },
  { type: 'T', value: null },
])

name: add
description: Add an OSC Atomic Data Type to the list of elements

name: pack
description: Interpret the Message as packed binary data

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data to read a Message

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding the binary representation of a Message

name: Message
description:
An OSC message consists of an OSC Address Pattern followed
by an OSC Type Tag String followed by zero or more OSC Arguments

name: constructor
examples: const message = new Message(['test', 'path'], 50, 100.52, 'test')
const message = new Message('/test/path', 51.2)

name: add
description: Add an OSC Atomic Data Type to the list of elements

name: src/osc.js
constructor
description: Create an OSC instance with given options
examples: const osc = new OSC() // default options with Websocket client
const osc = new OSC({ discardLateMessages: true })

const websocketPlugin = new OSC.WebsocketClientPlugin()
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: websocketPlugin })

params.name: options.discardLateMessages
params.description:
Ignore incoming
messages when given timetag lies in the past

params.name: options.plugin
params.description:
Add a connection plugin
to this interface, defaults to a plugin with Websocket client.
Open README.md for further information on how to handle plugins or
how to write your own with the Plugin API

name: on
description:
Listen to a status-change event or incoming OSC message with
address pattern matching

params.name: eventName
params.description: Event name or OSC address pattern

params.name: callback
params.description: Function which is called on notification

name: off

params.name: eventName
params.description: Event name or OSC address pattern

name: open
description:
Open network socket with plugin. This method is used by
plugins and is not available without (see Plugin API for more information)
examples:
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: new OSC.DatagramPlugin() })
osc.open({ host: '127.0.0.1', port: 8080 })

params.name: options
params.description: Custom global options for plugin instance

name: status
description:
Returns the current status of the connection. See *STATUS* for
different possible states. This method is used by plugins
and is not available without (see Plugin API for more information)

name: close
description:
Close connection. This method is used by plugins and is not
available without (see Plugin API for more information)

name: send
description:
Send an OSC Packet, Bundle or Message. This method is used by plugins
and is not available without (see Plugin API for more information)

params.name: packet
params.description: OSC Packet, Bundle or Message instance

name: src/packet.js
Packet
description:
The unit of transmission of OSC is an OSC Packet. The contents
of an OSC packet must be either an OSC Message or an OSC Bundle

name: constructor
description: Create a Packet instance holding a Message or Bundle

name: pack
description:
Packs the Packet value. This implementation is more like
a wrapper due to OSC specifications, you could also skip the
Packet and directly work with the Message or Bundle instance

name: unpack
description: Unpack binary data from DataView to read Messages or Bundles

params.name: dataView
params.description: The DataView holding a binary representation of a Packet

name: src/plugin/bridge.js
BridgePlugin
description:
OSC plugin for setting up communication between a Websocket
client and a udp client with a bridge inbetween

name: constructor
description:
Create an OSC Bridge instance with given options. Defaults to
localhost:41234 for udp server, localhost:41235 for udp client and
localhost:8080 for Websocket server
examples:
const plugin = new OSC.BridgePlugin({ wsServer: { port: 9912 } })
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: plugin })

<caption>Using an existing HTTP server</caption>
const http = require('http')
const httpServer = http.createServer();
const plugin = new OSC.BridgePlugin({ wsServer: { server: httpServer } })
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: plugin })

params.name: options.udpServer.host
params.description: Hostname of udp server to bind to

params.name: options.udpServer.port
params.description: Port of udp server to bind to

params.name: options.udpClient.host
params.description: Hostname of udp client for messaging

params.name: options.udpClient.port
params.description: Port of udp client for messaging

params.name: options.receiver
params.description:
Where messages sent via 'send' method will be
delivered to, 'ws' for Websocket clients, 'udp' for udp client

name: registerNotify
description:
Internal method to hook into osc library's
EventHandler notify method

name: status
description: Returns the current status of the connection

name: open
description: Bind a udp socket to a hostname and port

params.name: customOptions.host
params.description: Hostname of udp server to bind to

params.name: customOptions.port
params.description: Port of udp server to bind to

name: close
description: Close udp socket and Websocket server

name: send
description:
Send an OSC Packet, Bundle or Message. Use options here for
custom receiver, otherwise the global options will be taken

params.name: customOptions.udpClient.host
params.description: Hostname of udp client for messaging

params.name: customOptions.udpClient.port
params.description: Port of udp client for messaging

params.name: customOptions.receiver
params.description:
Messages will be delivered to Websocket ('ws')
clients or udp client ('udp')

name: src/plugin/dgram.js
DatagramPlugin
description:
OSC plugin for simple OSC messaging via udp client
and udp server

name: constructor
description:
Create an OSC Plugin instance with given options. Defaults to
localhost:41234 for server and localhost:41235 for client messaging
examples:
const plugin = new OSC.DatagramPlugin({ send: { port: 9912 } })
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: plugin })

params.name: options.open.host
params.description: Hostname of udp server to bind to

params.name: options.open.port
params.description: Port of udp server to bind to

params.name: options.send.host
params.description: Hostname of udp client for messaging

params.name: options.send.port
params.description: Port of udp client for messaging

name: registerNotify
description:
Internal method to hook into osc library's
EventHandler notify method

name: status
description: Returns the current status of the connection

name: open
description: Bind a udp socket to a hostname and port

params.name: customOptions.host
params.description: Hostname of udp server to bind to

params.name: customOptions.port
params.description: Port of udp server to bind to

name: send
description:
Send an OSC Packet, Bundle or Message. Use options here for
custom port and hostname, otherwise the global options will
be taken

name: src/plugin/wsclient.js
constructor
description:
Create an OSC WebsocketClientPlugin instance with given options.
Defaults to *localhost:8080* for connecting to a Websocket server
examples:
const plugin = new OSC.WebsocketClientPlugin({ port: 9912 })
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: plugin })

name: registerNotify
description:
Internal method to hook into osc library's
EventHandler notify method

name: status
description: Returns the current status of the connection

name: open
description: Connect to a Websocket server. Defaults to global options

name: send
description: Send an OSC Packet, Bundle or Message to Websocket server

name: src/plugin/wsserver.js
constructor
description:
Create an OSC WebsocketServerPlugin instance with given options.
Defaults to *localhost:8080* for the Websocket server
examples:
<caption>Using an existing HTTP server</caption>
const http = require('http')
const httpServer = http.createServer();
const plugin = new OSC.WebsocketServerPlugin({ server: httpServer })
const osc = new OSC({ plugin: plugin })

name: registerNotify
description:
Internal method to hook into osc library's
EventHandler notify method

name: status
description: Returns the current status of the connection

name: open
description: Start a Websocket server. Defaults to global options

name: send
description: Send an OSC Packet, Bundle or Message to Websocket clients

content:
osc-js ======

osc-js is an [Open Sound Control](http://opensoundcontrol.org/) library for JavaScript applications (UMD module for Node, Browser etc.) with address pattern matching and timetag handling. Sends messages via *UDP*, *WebSocket* or both (bridge mode) and offers a customizable Plugin API for network protocols. [Wiki](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki) | [Basic Usage](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki/Basic-Usage) | [Documentation](https://adzialocha.github.io/osc-js) | [Plugin API](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki/Plugin-API) ## Features - UMD Module running in Node.js, Electron, Chrome Apps, browser or any other JS environment - Can be used with Webpack and Browserify - No dependencies (except of `ws` in Node.js or similar environments) - Receive sender information from incoming messages - Built-in *UDP*, *WebSocket* networking support as plugins - Special bridge plugin for easy communication between *UDP*- and *WebSocket* clients - Plugin API for custom network protocols - Featuring all [OSC 1.0 specifications](http://opensoundcontrol.org/spec-1_0) - OSC Address pattern matching - Time-critical OSC Bundles with Timetags - Extended (nonstandard) argument types ## Documentation Read more about osc-js and how to use it in the [Wiki](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki) and [Documentation](https://adzialocha.github.io/osc-js). ## Example ```js const osc = new OSC() osc.on('/param/density', (message, rinfo) => { console.log(message.args) console.log(rinfo) }) osc.on('*', message => { console.log(message.args) }) osc.on('/{foo,bar}/*/param', message => { console.log(message.args) }) osc.on('open', () => { const message = new OSC.Message('/test', 12.221, 'hello') osc.send(message) }) osc.open({ port: 9000 }) ``` ## Installation and Usage Recommended installation via npm: `npm i osc-js` or `yarn add osc-js`. Import the library `const OSC = require('osc-js')` or add the script `lib/osc.js` or `lib/osc.min.js` (minified version) for usage in a browser. ## Plugins osc-js offers a plugin architecture for extending it's networking capabilities. The library comes with four built-in plugins. This is propably all you need for an OSC application: - `WebsocketClientPlugin` (default) - `WebsocketServerPlugin` - `DatagramPlugin` for UDP network messaging - `BridgePlugin` useful Bridge between WebSocket- and UDP Clients Configuration and examples of every plugin can be read here: [Wiki](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki). ### Example: WebSocket Server Register the plugin when creating the OSC instance: ```js const osc = new OSC({ plugin: new OSC.WebsocketServerPlugin() }) osc.open() // listening on 'ws://localhost:8080' ``` ### Example: OSC between MaxMSP/PD/SC etc. and your browser 1. Write a simple webpage. The library will use a WebSocket client by default. ```html ``` 2. Write a Node app (the "bridge" between your UDP and WebSocket clients). ```js const OSC = require('osc-js') const config = { udpClient: { port: 9129 } } const osc = new OSC({ plugin: new OSC.BridgePlugin(config) }) osc.open() // start a WebSocket server on port 8080 ``` 3. Create your Max/MSP patch (or PD, SuperCollider etc.). ``` [udpreceive 9129] // incoming '/test/random' messages with random number ``` ### Custom solutions with Plugin API It is possible to write more sophisticated solutions for OSC applications without loosing the osc-js interface (including its message handling etc.). Read the [Plugin API documentation](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki/Plugin-API) for further information. ```js class MyCustomPlugin { // ... read docs for implementation details } const osc = new OSC({ plugin: MyCustomPlugin() }) osc.open() osc.on('/test', message => { // use event listener with your plugin }) ``` ### Usage without plugins The library can be used without the mentioned features in case you need to write and read binary OSC data. See this example below for using the [Low-Level API](https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/wiki/Low-Level-API) (even though the library already has a solution for handling UDP like in this example): ```js const dgram = require('dgram') const OSC = require('osc-js') const socket = dgram.createSocket('udp4') // send a messsage via udp const message = new OSC.Message('/some/path', 21) const binary = message.pack() socket.send(new Buffer(binary), 0, binary.byteLength, 41234, 'localhost') // receive a message via UDP socket.on('message', data => { const msg = new OSC.Message() msg.unpack(data) console.log(msg.args) }) ``` ## Development osc-js uses [Babel](http://babeljs.io) for ES6 support, [ESDoc](https://esdoc.org) for documentation, [Mocha](https://mochajs.org/) + [Chai](http://chaijs.com/) for testing and [Rollup](https://rollupjs.org) for generating the UMD module. Clone the repository and install all dependencies: ``` git clone git@github.com:adzialocha/osc-js.git cd osc-js npm install ``` ### Testing `npm run test` for running the tests. `npm run test:watch` for running specs during development. Check code style with `npm run lint`. ### Deployment `npm run build` for exporting UMD module in `lib` folder. ### Contributors * [@adzialocha](https://github.com/adzialocha) * [@davidgranstrom](https://github.com/davidgranstrom) * [@elgiano](https://github.com/elgiano) * [@eliot-akira](https://github.com/eliot-akira) * [@PeterKey](https://github.com/PeterKey) * [@yaxu](https://github.com/yaxu) ### ESDocs `npm run docs` for generating a `docs` folder with HTML files documenting the library. Read them online here: [https://adzialocha.github.io/osc-js](https://adzialocha.github.io/osc-js) ## License MIT License `MIT`
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "osc-js",
  "version": "2.3.1",
  "description": "OSC library for Node.js and the browser, with customizable Plugin API for WebSocket, UDP or bridge networking",
  "main": "lib/osc.js",
  "browser": "lib/osc.min.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rollup -c",
    "docs": "esdoc",
    "lint": "eslint rollup.config.js src/** test/**",
    "test": "mocha test/** --require @babel/register --exit",
    "test:watch": "mocha test/** --require @babel/register --reporter min --watch test/** src/**"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+ssh://git@github.com/adzialocha/osc-js.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "osc",
    "data",
    "open",
    "sound",
    "control",
    "websocket",
    "udp",
    "datagram",
    "network"
  ],
  "author": "Andreas Dzialocha",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js/issues"
  },
  "files": [
    "lib"
  ],
  "homepage": "https://github.com/adzialocha/osc-js#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "7.17.9",
    "@babel/eslint-parser": "7.17.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "7.16.11",
    "@babel/register": "7.17.7",
    "@rollup/plugin-alias": "^3.1.9",
    "@rollup/plugin-babel": "^5.3.1",
    "chai": "4.3.6",
    "chai-spies-next": "0.9.3",
    "esdoc": "1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.0.0",
    "eslint": "8.13.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "15.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "2.26.0",
    "mocha": "9.2.2",
    "rollup": "2.70.1",
    "rollup-plugin-cleanup": "3.2.1",
    "rollup-plugin-terser": "7.0.2"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "ws": "^8.5.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
test/atomic/blob.spec.js
it3
description: returns the first 8 bit for the size of the data

name: it7
description: sets the value to our blob

name: test/atomic/float32.spec.js
it14
description: sets the value to a human readable float number

name: test/atomic/int32.spec.js
it21
description: sets the value to a human readable number

name: test/atomic/int64.spec.js
it24
description: throws an error in constructor if out of bounds

name: it30
description: sets the value to a human readable number

name: test/atomic/string.spec.js
it34
description: sets the offset to a multiple of 4

name: it35
description: sets the value to a human readable string

name: it38
description: converts a long string without throwing RangeError

name: test/atomic/timetag.spec.js
it40
description: sets the values correctly on initialization

name: test/atomic/uint64.spec.js
it57
description: throws an error in constructor if out of bounds

name: it63
description: sets the value to a human readable number

name: test/atomic.spec.js

description: sets the given value on construction

name: it66

name: it71

name: test/bundle.spec.js
it73
description: contains a set of osc bundle data

name: test/common/helpers.spec.js
it85
description: returns the right OSC Type Tag characters

name: it87
description: builds an valid  address from an array

name: it88
description: builds an valid  address from an invalid string

name: it91
description: adds items up and increases the byteLength accordingly

name: it92
description: merges the items to one Uint8Array

name: test/common/utils.spec.js
test/events.spec.js
it101
description: returns different subscription ids for each listener

name: it102
description: registers a handler which can be called

name: it105
description: returns false when handler was not found

name: it118
description: calls two listeners with the same address

name: test/message.spec.js
it130
description: contains a set of osc message data

name: it131
description: can be initialized with an address

description: can be initialized with an address and argument array

description: pushes the values to our args array

name: it135
description: adds to the types string accordingly

name: it137
description: returns an object we can unpack again

name: it143
description: contains a set of osc message data

name: it144
